results.definition: be oriented
examples: The weather vane points North
the dancers toes pointed outward

results.definition: sail close to the wind
repair the joints of bricks
examples: point a chimney

results.definition: any of 32 horizontal directions indicated on the card of a compass
examples: he checked the point on his compass

results.definition: be a signal for or a symptom of
examples: Her behavior points to a severe neurosis

results.definition: a specific identifiable position in a continuum or series or especially in a process
a distinct part that can be specified separately in a group of things that could be enumerated on a list
examples: the main point on the agenda was taken up first

results.definition: an outstanding characteristic
examples: his acting was one of the high points of the movie

results.definition: a V shape
examples: the cannibal's teeth were filed to sharp points

results.definition: a contact in the distributor; as the rotor turns its projecting arm contacts them and current flows to the spark plugs
the dot at the left of a decimal fraction
direct into a position for use
examples: point a gun

results.definition: indicate a place, direction, person, or thing; either spatially or figuratively
examples: He pointed to the empty parking space

results.definition: the property of a shape that tapers to a sharp tip
the gun muzzle's direction
examples: he held me up at the point of a gun

results.definition: a V-shaped mark at one end of an arrow pointer
examples: the point of the arrow was due north

results.definition: an isolated fact that is considered separately from the whole
examples: a point of information

results.definition: a wall socket
inRegion: united kingdom of great britain and northern ireland

results.definition: an instant of time
examples: at that point I had to leave

results.definition: a very small circular shape
examples: a row of points

results.definition: direct the course; determine the direction of travelling
give a point to
intend (something) to move towards a certain goal
a punctuation mark (.) placed at the end of a declarative sentence to indicate a full stop or after abbreviations
a brief version of the essential meaning of something
examples: get to the point
he missed the point of the joke
life has lost its point

results.definition: a distinguishing or individuating characteristic
examples: he knows my bad points as well as my good points

results.definition: a geometric element that has position but no extension
examples: a point is defined by its coordinates

results.definition: a linear unit used to measure the size of type; approximately 1/72 inch
a promontory extending out into a large body of water
examples: they sailed south around the point

results.definition: a style in speech or writing that arrests attention and has a penetrating or convincing quality or effect
be positionable in a specified manner
examples: The gun points with ease

results.definition: indicate the presence of (game) by standing and pointing with the muzzle
examples: the dog pointed the dead duck

results.definition: mark (a psalm text) to indicate the points at which the music changes
mark (Hebrew words) with diacritics
mark with diacritics
examples: point the letter

results.definition: one percent of the total principal of a loan; it is paid at the time the loan is made and is independent of the interest on the loan
sharp end
examples: he stuck the point of the knife into a tree
he broke the point of his pencil

results.definition: the object of an activity
examples: what is the point of discussing it?

results.definition: the precise location of something; a spatially limited location
examples: she walked to a point where she could survey the whole street

results.definition: the unit of counting in scoring a game or contest
examples: he scored 20 points in the first half
a touchdown counts 6 points
